item.title: PowerShell Script to create office 365 shortcuts
item.description: I didn’t find any post which was talking about this so here I am with my little contribution. And a reminder for myself aswell. In PowerShell because it’s better. We don’t have sortcuts so we will create them the simpliest way possible. Here is an example with Outlook (Office 365 or Office 2019 Pro Plus) : # We prepare the creation of the shortcut $objShell = New-Object -ComObject ("WScript.Shell") # Where the shortcut go $objShortCut = $objShell.
